{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.20850v1", "title": "Nuclear Dimension for Virtually Abelian Groups", "summary": "Let $G$ be a finitely generated virtually abelian group. We show that the
Hirsch length, $h(G)$, is equal to the nuclear dimension of its group
$C^*$-algebra, $\dim_{nuc}(C^*(G))$. We then specialize our attention to a
generalization of crystallographic groups dubbed $\textit{crystal-like}$. We
demonstrate that in this scenario a $\textit{point group}$ is well defined and
the order of this point group is preserved by $C^*$-isomorphism. In addition,
we provide a counter-example to $C^*$-superrigidity within this crystal-like
setting.", "main_category": "math.OA", "categories": "math.OA,math.GR,math.RT", "published": "2025-04-29T15:19:25Z"}
